items.title: Save up to $200 on Autel’s latest outdoor cams with solar panels, local storage, HDMI, more – at new lows from $156
items.summary:
The official Autel Amazon storefront is giving us even more savings than ever on its new 2-cam Outdoor Wireless Solar Security Camera kit at $156 shipped, which isn’t offered directly from the brand, while the 4-cam kit is down at $199 shipped, and does match its direct pricing. A new branch of Autel’s devices, these models have spent the time since their release in August through October keeping to their $299 and $399 price tags, which we’ve been seeing steadily ramping up discounts since early Black Friday sales. First they received cuts to $249 and $299, with the 2-cam pack then going lower to $199, while the 4-cam dropped to $254. Today’s deal brings larger-than-ever $143 and $200 markdowns off their full tag rates, landing them at new all-time low prices just in time to score them ahead of Christmas.

items.title: Automate sleep-friendly routines and get a good night’s rest during the holidays with these Aqara smart home products
items.summary:
Smart home gadgets, as you probably already know, can do so much more than basic lighting tricks. In fact, they can be surprisingly effective at improving your sleep quality. With the right setup in place, you can create personalized bedtime routines that can help you effortlessly wind down and get a good night’s sleep. Aqara is one of the brands that is at the forefront of this, offering devices that work smoothly with Apple HomeKit, Amazon Alexa, and Google Home. They’re simple to use, thoughtfully designed, and packed with features to help you drift off more comfortably – especially during the holidays when you finally get a chance to unwind.

items.title: Ford and SK On are ending their US battery joint venture
items.summary: The factories live on; the joint venture will not. The two companies will divide the assets: Ford will take ownership and operation of the twin battery plants in Kentucky, while SK On will operate the factory at the massive BlueOval SK campus in Tennessee.
